result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley Richard Potter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham January 13, 2017 - add conditional jail time.

Defendant to be released from custody today December 8, 2015 and report to Probation by 4:00 p.m.
Court notes 248 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Court reserves on the 60 days right now.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF353.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF353.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to maintain mental health treatment and Department to treat as a dual diagnosis.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to participate in MRT if he qualifies.
-Random testing.
-Defendant to seek work and find meaningful and gainful employment.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time, IMPOSED.
Upon release from jail Defendant to immediately report to Probation.

supervisions.notes:
-Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
-Defendant to report to Probation within 24 hours from release.
-If Defendant is in Polk County Jail and Agent is to meet with him no later than Monday  November 3, 2014.
-Court notes no credit against ultimate sentence.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $150.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF353.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF353.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF353.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Subject to random testing.
-Maintain current mental health treatment and follow any recommendations.
-Cognitive Intervention Program.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes, DF:  Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail, pro se. Includes 15CF142 and 14CF353. Cases called at 9:41 am. Hearing on 14CF353 request to modify sentence and impose conditional time. DEF does not wish to retain counsel, Atty. Kucinski met with DEF in the jail. Court finds DEF freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel. DA Nieskes addresses Court, state is in agreement. Probation Agent requests 30 days conditional time in St. Croix County Jail. 21 days have already been served. DEF does not object. Court imposes 30 days condition time in St. Croix County jail with credit for 21 days. Court Orders immediately upon discharge, DEF to report to Probation Agent. DEF will reside with grandparents after release. Adjourned 9:47 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann DF: Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail. Case called at 3:42. Includes 14CF353, 15CF142. Court reviews files. ADA Minser believes there is a resolution. Court reviews agreement with DE. Court questions DE on agreement. Court finds the DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes the agreement. Court enters a jmt on Ct. 1 in 14CF353. DE is still on probation for Ct. 2 and will still be of record. Court dismisses without objection 15CF142 with prejudice.  Court orders a PSI to be completed by Dec. 1, 2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann DF: Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail. Case called at 3:00. Includes 15CF142, 14CF353. Set for a motion hearing. Court reviews file. There have been no motions filed on the 15CF142 file. Atty. Amann has not filed any motions and will not be filing any motions except Motions in Limine. Court reserves on motion to revoke in the 14CF353 until the FPT.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF353 and 15CF142:
Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle.:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail. Case called at 3:24 p.m. ADA Hartung filed information. Court reads charges and penalties. Atty Amann waives further reading and enters NG pleas on both counts. Court at this time will maintain bond in current form and amount. Order state to provide discovery within the next 10 business days. Motions to be filed within 10 business days after discovery. Speedy trial demand. Atty Amann to see JA for trial date. Regarding case 14CF353, DJOC on that file. ADA Hartung states that if defendant can set up a furlough for treatment, they would be in agreement.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail. Prelim on 15CF142 and STC on 14CF353. Case called at 4:32 p.m. Trooper C. Pratt appears on behalf of WI State Patrol. Trooper C. Pratt is sworn and testifies. Direct by ADA Hartung. Exhibit #1 - Lab Report, marked by ADA Hartung. Trooper identifies DE in Court. Cross by Atty. Amann. Atty. Hartung offers Exhibit #1. ADA Hartung requests Court take judicial notice of bond attached to complaint in 14CF353. Court receives Exhibit #1 and takes judicial notice of 14CF353 and bond. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court continues bond. Atty. Amann requests modification to bond, conversion to co-signature bond and residing with C. and T. Erickson. ADA Hartung gives state's position. Court directs State to begin providing Discovery and Trooper to provide Discovery to the State. Adjourned 4:58 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Restitution = $150.00 and Court Obs = $458.00 filed this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Julie Ann Weber   DF:  Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail. ADA Mckinley informs DE of agreement. Victims rights have been complied with. DE is on a PO hold. DE has not completed a compas evaluation. DE pleads guilty to Cts 1 and 2. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and and Ct 2. Crt withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC in Ct 1.  Recommendations. Victim statements. DE makes statement. Crt orders in Ct 2:  Sentence: W/H,  1 year probation with conditions.

Conditions of probation are:

-60 day jail - STAYED.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.to probation 

-Subject to random testing.
-Maintain current mental health treatment and follow any recommendations
-Cognitive intervention program.
-Restitution $150.00. Payable through probation.
-Court Costs $443.00 and supervision costs. Payable through probation.

Court notes no credit against any ulitmate sentence. Crt sets for probation review hearing. DE to report to probation within 24 hours from release. If DE is in Polk County jail an agent is to meet with him no later than Monday, November 3, 2014.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Julie Ann Weber   DF:  Riley Richard Potter appeared from jail.  Case called at 4:29 p.m. DE waives preliminary hearing. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt questions DE. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Crt accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial.  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Plea hearing on October 28, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Terrence Joseph E.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
